page.title: 13RECREATION IN TADLEY
page.content: For those who do want to go out and "do something" the Hurst Community School and affiliated clubs provide facilities for: archery, art, ATC, badminton, bowls, basketball, choir, climbing, debating, football, guitar, gymnastics, hockey, judo, netball, photography, skittles, squash, swimming, table tennis, tennis and wado karate. There is also a full range of evening classes. Everyone from six to sixty-six is catered for. Teenagers can go in for the Duke of Edinburgh's Award Scheme or attend one of the three different Youth Clubs. In spite of all this there are still constant complaints from some young people that there is nothing to do around Tadley. The Sports Centre which many people demanded is being built at the Calleva Industrial Park.
